Yuddhajayā(rṇava)[­nāma]­tantra­rāja­svarodaya­nāma
The King of Astrological Texts called “The Yuddhajayārṇava Tantra”

bibl.author: Anon
Jayānanda (Kaśmīr)
bod kyi lo tsA ba glo bo shes rab rin chen

notesStmt.note: Title: The exact meaning of yuddhajayārṇava is unclear. The Tibetan translators seem to have had difficulty with it as well, rendering only yuddhajaya as “Victory in Battle” (g.yul las rnam par rgyal ba), while omitting arṇava (“agitation”, “wave”, or “ocean”). One possible meaning is related to terms of Indian astrology in which a conjunction of the planets that does not involve the sun or moon is referred to as an “encounter” (yuddha) and one of the planets is Saturn (jaya). Hence a possible translation of yuddhajayārṇava could be “The Ocean of Planetary Conjunctions Involving Saturn.”
